title: How to Know if a Message Was Read on WhatsApp: Checkmarks Explained

steps.title: Open the WhatsApp app and tap the "Chats" tab.
steps.content: Open the WhatsApp app and tap the "Chats" tab. You can find this tab at the bottom (iPhone) or at the top (Android) of the app. WhatsApp is available for iPhone in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . Keep in mind you must have your own Read Receipts turned on to see the Read Receipts of others.

steps.title: Tap a conversation.
steps.content: Tap a conversation. This will open the conversation in full.

steps.title: Review your last message's checkmarks.
steps.content: Review your last message's checkmarks. These will be in the bottom right corner of your message bubble. Checkmarks change according to your message's status: [1] X Research source One grey checkmark - Your message was successfully sent. Two grey checkmarks - Your message was received by your recipient's phone. Two blue checkmarks - Your recipient read your message on WhatsApp. Group message checkmarks only turn blue after each participant in the group has seen the message. [2] X Research source Two grey checkmarks (Read Receipts disabled) - Your message was successfully sent and may or may not be read.

steps.title: Confirm that there are two blue checkmarks.
steps.content: Confirm that there are two blue checkmarks. Now you know that your message was read. [3] X Research source Keep in mind that if the recipient has Read Receipts turned off, you won't see two blue checkmarks ; you'll only see two grey checkmarks.

steps.title: Open the WhatsApp app and tap Settings.
steps.content: Open the WhatsApp app and tap Settings . If you're using an iPhone, you can find this in the bottom-right corner of the app. On Android, tap the three-dots icon in the top-right corner first. You must have your own Read Receipts turned on to see the Read Receipts of others. If you have this feature disabled on your end, the most you will see is two grey checkmarks.

steps.title: Tap Privacy.
steps.content: Tap Privacy . You'll find this underneath Account .

steps.title: Toggle on "Read Receipts".
steps.content: Toggle on "Read Receipts". You may need to scroll down to find this option. This will let other users know when you have read their message. Read receipts are always sent for group chats ; you cannot disable this feature for group chats.

steps.title: Does one checkmark mean I'm blocked?
steps.content: Does one checkmark mean I'm blocked? Social media security expert Naveh Ben Dror confirms that if you're blocked by someone on WhatsApp, your messages won't reach them. Therefore, you'll only see a single check mark below any messages you try to send. However, one checkmark can also indicate a faulty connection on the other user's end.

steps.title: Do I need Read Receipts turned on?
steps.content: Do I need Read Receipts turned on? If you want to see the Read Receipts of other users, you must have your own Read Receipts turned on. If you don't, you'll only see two grey checkmarks at most.

steps.title: How do I know if I'm blocked on WhatsApp?
steps.content: How do I know if I'm blocked on WhatsApp? If you're blocked on WhatsApp, you'll be unable to call the recipient, successfully send messages with two blue checkmarks, see their "Last seen" status, or view new profile pictures. If all of these are true, it's likely you've been blocked.

steps.title: What should I do if my message wasn't read?
steps.content: What should I do if my message wasn't read? If your message wasn't read, don't automatically assume you've been blocked. Try waiting a few hours to see if the user is simply busy. They may be having internet issues or device issues. If you need to contact them urgently, you can try using a different social media platform instead.

steps.title: What do two checkmarks mean on WhatsApp?
steps.content: What do two checkmarks mean on WhatsApp? If you see two grey checkmarks on WhatsApp, this means your message was successfully sent to the recipient, but it has not been read yet. If you see two blue checkmarks, this means your message was successfully sent and the recipient has seen it. Keep in mind that if you or the recipient has Read Receipts disabled, you'll only see two grey checkmarks regardless of whether they've read the message or not.
